channel.title: Devolution Objects
channel.description:
Why can't i click on any objects on Devolution 7.0?
I have tryed:
packet132 Making a new void that used the: switch(objectID){ but didnt work.
Anyone got a solution as to why these arent working?

item.title: Devolution Objects
item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.description:
@Trigger1 wrote:

[quote=“filth scape, post:1, topic:237980”]You should see something like this near the top of packet 132:

if (!found && adding) server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 1)); if (!found && (objectID != blah)) break;

Replace with:

if (!found && adding) server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 1)); if (!found && (objectID != objectID)) break;[/quote]
Even better. Remove those.

Read full topic

item.title: Devolution Objects
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Damnit, I thought you could get farther on getting them to work after me telling you the correct answer twice.

Anyway, since you don’t know how…

Go into your config folder, open the objects file, and inside, add this;

object = objectid	xcoord	ycoord	optiontowork

Read full topic

item.title: Devolution Objects
item.dc:creator: @brick53 brick53
item.description:
@brick53 wrote:

Heres my script:

[code] case 132:
int objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
int objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
int objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
int face = 0;
int face2 = 0;
int GateID = 1;

		if (!validClient || randomed)
			break;

		if (!antiHax())
			break;

		if (debug || (playerRights > 1)) {
			println("serverobjs size " + server.objects.size());
			println_debug("atObject: " + objectX + "," + objectY
					+ " objectID: " + objectID); // 147 might be id for
			// object state changing
		}

		int xDiff = Math.abs(absX - objectX);
		int yDiff = Math.abs(absY - objectY);
		boolean found = false;
		for (Object o : server.objects) {
			if ((o.type == 1) && (objectX == o.x) && (objectY == o.y)
					&& (objectID == o.id)) {
				found = true;
				break;
			}
		}
		if (!found && adding)
			server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 1));

		if (!found && (objectID != 2646) && (objectID != 1530) && (objectID !=4878)) //4878 is the object id i want to use
			break;
		resetAction(false);
		TurnPlayerTo(objectX, objectY);
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		if ((xDiff > 5) || (yDiff > 5)) {
			// sendMessage("Client hack detected!");
			break;
		}
		if (objectID == 4878) {
			sendMessage("WORKS?????!?!?!??!?!?");
			}

break;[/code]

As you see i have changed my blah to the object id and added it into the packet to be clicked on.

Read full topic

item.title: Devolution Objects
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

After you have added the object in your first object click packet, you must add it inside object.cfg also.

Read full topic
